Description: A form of Vitamin B3 that helps strengthen the skin barrier, reduce redness, and minimize pores.
HumanHealth: Well-tolerated by most, effective for acne and anti-aging.

Description: Binds up to 1,000 times its weight in water; boosts hydration and elasticity.
Source: Produced by fermenting plant-derived sugars using non-pathogenic bacteria
HumanHealth: Not harmful, as it is naturally produced by humans

Description: Strong detergent and foaming agent that removes oils and dirt.
Source: Synthetic, derived from coconut or palm oil
HumanHealth: Can be irritating to skin and eyes in high concentrations, generally safe in small amounts
EnvironmentalImpact: Can be toxic to aquatic life; biodegrades slowly

Description: Draws moisture from the air into the skin; very gentle and effective.
Source: Derived from plant oils or produced synthetically from petroleum-based sources
EnvironmentalImpact: Biodegradable and environmentally friendly but can contribute to deforestation

Description: A silicone that forms a smooth, protective layer.
Source: Synthetic; made from silicon, oxygen, and hydrocarbons
EnvironmentalImpact: Does not break down as easily as natural ingredients

Description: Brightens, smooths texture, and boosts cell turnover.
Source: Originally extracted from sugarcane, now produced synthetically
HumanHealth: Can cause irritation at high concentrations

Description: Protects skin lipids and enhances other antioxidants.
Source: Derived from vegetable oils or made synthetically in labs
HumanHealth: Usually safe, but if overused, can clog pores in some people

Description: A synthetic preservative used to prevent bacteria and mold.
Source: Produced by reacting phenol with ethylene oxide
HumanHealth: Safe in low amounts (<1%); can cause skin or eye irritation
EnvironmentalImpact: Biodegrades slowly; can be toxic in aquatic environments

Description: The primary solvent in most cosmetic formulations, used to dissolve other ingredients.
An alpha-hydroxy acid (AHA) used to adjust the pH of products and provide mild exfoliation.
HumanHealth: Safe in cosmetic concentrations, can cause mild irritation if pH is too low.
